text: Va'aiga Lealuga Tuigamala (4 September 1969 – 24 February 2022), sometimes known as Inga Tuigamala, was a Samoan professional rugby union and rugby league player. He was born in Faleasiu, Western Samoa. He represented New Zealand in rugby union from 1989 until 1993, making 19 appearances. Tuigamala died on 24 February 2022 in Auckland, New Zealand at the age of 52. At the time of his death, he had diabetes and high blood pressure.Va’aiga Tuigamala, former All Blacks winger, dies at 52 ==References== ==Other websites== * Va'aiga Tuigamala Wigan Career Page on the Wigan RL Fansite. *Wasps profile Category:1969 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Samoan sportspeople Category:Rugby union players Category:Rugby league players
title: Va'aiga Tuigamala
